benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: POST /1.0/kb/invoiceItems/{invoiceItemId}/customFields - Add custom fields to invoice item

covered: Valid Payload: TC01, TC02, TC03, TC04 cover successful creation with varying payloads and headers.

Validation/Error Handling: TC06 (invalid ID format), TC07 (missing header), TC08 (malformed body), TC09 (missing body), TC11 (extra fields), TC12 (unauthorized), TC13 (service unavailable), TC14 (large payload behavior), TC15 (response time expectation), TC18 (integration persistence check).
Edge/Boundary Cases: TC10 (empty array), TC19 (max/min length values), TC20 (special characters), TC21 (XSS/injection risk).
Not Found / State Scenarios: TC05 (non-existent invoice item), TC22 (empty DB), TC23 (partially populated DB).
Concurrency/Resilience: TC16 (concurrent requests), TC24 (degraded performance), TC25 (transient network recovery).
Retrieval/Integration: TC18 confirms persistence and retrieval via GET.
gaps: Authorization beyond basic header presence: explicit 401/403 handling already covered in TC12, but no role-based or token-expiration edge cases beyond generic unauthorized.
Rate Limiting: no tests for throttling or burst handling.
Caching Behavior: no tests for caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control).

Duplicate Submission Handling: while TC11 contemplates extra/unknown fields and mentions duplicates as a possibility, there is no explicit dedicated test validating idempotent/duplicate submission handling (e.g., repeated identical requests).
Explicit 500 Internal Server Error scenario: only 503 (service unavailable) is tested; a 500 scenario could be exercised to differentiate server/database failures.
recommendations: Add explicit rate-limiting/throttling tests to verify behavior under high request volume.
Add tests for caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control) on POST responses where applicable.
Add a dedicated idempotency/duplicate-submission test to verify behavior when the same payload is posted multiple times (deduplication vs. error).
Add a dedicated 500 Internal Server Error scenario to distinguish between application and database failure modes, in addition to 503.
